title: 4-D Sequence: Moving Image Methods
description: This class explores the signature formal properties and possibilities of video and provides critical frameworks for understanding moving image work. A series of hands-on projects will introduce video production techniques, with a focus on accessible approaches over technically-complex ones. Screenings from various cinema and video art traditions will provide context for these explorations and help guide critique of participants' own work. One thematic focus will be on framing the everyday, the overlooked, and the incidental, which provides a useful bridge to some of the key concerns of graphic design practice â¹ how to direct attention, create emphasis, make manifest the latent and the liminal. In addition to production strategies, the class will offer exercises that focus attention on the act of attention itself, to investigate how video can augment and transfigure the act of observation and uniquely represent what is observed. All these exercises will build toward the completion of a larger video project incorporating the approaches introduced throughout the semester. Participants will leave the class with the technical and critical facility to incorporate moving image work thoughtfully in their own art practices.
